description: Periodic part of continued fraction for sqrt(n), encoded by raising successive primes to the terms. If sqrt(n)=c0+[c1,c2,c3...] then a(n)=2^c1*3^c2*5^c3*...
comments: Could be made less gigantic by omitting final terms in continued fraction, which are always 2*c0.
author: _Marc LeBrun_, Feb 07 2001
